medical_history.chief_complaint: Deficit in anterior pituitary function and variable immune deficiency (DAVID), characterized by adrenocorticotropin (ACTH) deficiency and severe infections.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: ACTH deficiency diagnosed from ages 5 to 15 years, with symptomatic hypoglycemia. Common variable immunodeficiency (CVID) diagnosed from ages 2 to 8 years, revealed by recurrent infections.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Three of the four patients had a hypoplastic pituitary. One patient had low IGF-I and subnormal GH response to stimulation.
medical_history.family_history: At least one familial case was identified, with two siblings affected by CVID and ACTH deficiency.
